header: ORDER BELOW EXH. 1 IN CRI. MISC. APPLICATION No. 72/2019 (Sanket @ Phutir Shinde Vs. State of Maharashtra) CNR : MHST01­000389­2019

background.text: 1) Application is filed by the applicant under section 439 of Criminal Procedure Code, 1973 on his arrest in C.R.No. 49 of 2019 under Sec. 303, 387, 120­B, 143, 147, 148, 149 of Indian Penal Code.

legalActFound.stringMatched: under section 439 of criminal procedure code

arguments.text: 2) It is contended that, complainant had witnessed the assault on the deceased near Sanhyadri Steel, near petrol pump by accused Mayur Jadhav, Sourabh Kharat, Dhiraj Shelke and others by means of deadly weapons i.e. sickle, sattur, bat etc. Present applicant is one of the said accused persons. It is stated that, applicant is innocent and has no connection with the offence and he is ready to abide the conditions imposed by the Court if he is released on bail.

argumentSentences.text: 2) It is contended that, complainant had witnessed the assault on the deceased near Sanhyadri Steel, near petrol pump by accused Mayur Jadhav, Sourabh Kharat, Dhiraj Shelke and others by means of deadly weapons i.e. sickle, sattur, bat etc.
Present applicant is one of the said accused persons.
It is stated that, applicant is innocent and has no connection with the offence and he is ready to abide the conditions imposed by the Court if he is released on bail.

arguments.text: 3) Learned A.P.P has filed say at Exh.6. It is contended that, Special I.G.P. Kolhapur has sanctioned the proposal sent by S.P. Satara to initiate action against the applicants under MCOCA as they have been found to be involved in associated crime, the other accused involved in crime are habitual criminals. Hence, this court has no jurisdiction to try present application, it be rejected.

argumentSentences.text: 3) Learned A.P.P has filed say at Exh.6.

It is contended that, Special I.G.P. Kolhapur has sanctioned the proposal sent by S.P. Satara to initiate action against the applicants under MCOCA as they have been found to be involved in associated crime, the other accused involved in crime are habitual criminals.
Hence, this court has no jurisdiction to try present application, it be rejected.

arguments.text: 4) It is submitted that, Special I.G.P. Kolhapur has sanctioned the proposal sent by S.P. Satara to initiate action against the applicants under MCOCA, hence, this Court ceased to have power to grant bail. By accepting the contention in say, application is required to be rejected. Hence, the order.

argumentSentences.text: 4) It is submitted that, Special I.G.P. Kolhapur has sanctioned the proposal sent by S.P. Satara to initiate action against the applicants under MCOCA, hence, this Court ceased to have power to grant bail.
By accepting the contention in say, application is required to be rejected.

order.text: ORDER 1) Cr.Misc. Application No. 72 of 2019 is rejected.

footer: (B.S.Wavre) Place : Satara Addl. Sessions Judge Date : 27th February, 2019 Satara
processedText:
ORDER BELOW EXH. 1 IN CRI. MISC. APPLICATION No. 72/2019 (Sanket @ Phutir Shinde Vs. State of Maharashtra) CNR : MHST01­000389­2019 
---header-ends---
1) Application is filed by the applicant under section 439 of Criminal Procedure Code, 1973 on his arrest in C.R.No. 49 of 2019 under Sec. 303, 387, 120­B, 143, 147, 148, 149 of Indian Penal Code. 
---background-ends---
2) It is contended that, complainant had witnessed the assault on the deceased near Sanhyadri Steel, near petrol pump by accused Mayur Jadhav, Sourabh Kharat, Dhiraj Shelke and others by means of deadly weapons i.e. sickle, sattur, bat etc. Present applicant is one of the said accused persons. It is stated that, applicant is innocent and has no connection with the offence and he is ready to abide the conditions imposed by the Court if he is released on bail. 
---argument-ends---
3) Learned A.P.P has filed say at Exh.6. It is contended that, Special I.G.P. Kolhapur has sanctioned the proposal sent by S.P. Satara to initiate action against the applicants under MCOCA as they have been found to be involved in associated crime, the other accused involved in crime are habitual criminals. Hence, this court has no jurisdiction to try present application, it be rejected. 
---argument-ends---
4) It is submitted that, Special I.G.P. Kolhapur has sanctioned the proposal sent by S.P. Satara to initiate action against the applicants under MCOCA, hence, this Court ceased to have power to grant bail. By accepting the contention in say, application is required to be rejected. Hence, the order. 
---argument-ends---
ORDER 1) Cr.Misc. Application No. 72 of 2019 is rejected. 
---order-ends---
(B.S.Wavre) Place : Satara Addl. Sessions Judge Date : 27th February, 2019 Satara
